page.title: 10CLUBS AND ASSOCIATIONS
page.content: Belper town is well served with clubs and associations, There are many sports clubs and associations for {recreational, educational}and {charitable}purposes. These are the clubs attended by one family that might be considered as typical. Father...Local History,Cricket Campaign for Real Ale. Mother...runs post natal classes,keep fit and relaxation classes. Son......Scouts and Football. Daughter.Brownies and Drama club. The centres for these clubs are often in the centre of the town. People from the newer estates and from the villages of Milford and Hazelwood have to travel to Belper for their associations. In 1984{The Milford Community Assoc_ {iation}fought the{Education Committee to save their school from closure.
